section.name: Introduction
section.p: jDTAUS Core provides a common application programming interface for jDTAUS integration. It comes split into various artifacts of different namespaces.

subsection.name: org.jdtaus.common: Application programming interface
subsection.p: Artifacts of group org.jdtaus.common build the application programming interface. The Core artifact provides interfaces to core application services like task monitoring, data validation or modular implementation management.

Maven: Artifacts of group org.jdtaus.common are the only artifacts needed in the compile classpath when building applications. The Core artifact will almost ever be pulled in transitively as may other common artifacts.

subsection.name: org.jdtaus.spi: Implementation programming interfaces
subsection.p: Artifacts of group org.jdtaus.spi build the implementation programming interface. The Core artifact provides interfaces to be used by implementations to expose core application services to applications.

Maven: Artifacts of group org.jdtaus.spi are needed in the compile classpath when building implementations but not when building applications. Since implementations depend on them during compile time they will almost ever be pulled in transitively via the application's runtime artifacts.

subsection.name: org.jdtaus.runtime: Application runtime
subsection.p: Artifacts of group org.jdtaus.runtime build the application runtime. These are standalone implementations implementing specifications from group org.jdtaus.common and providing core application services by using the interfaces defined in group org.jdtaus.spi.
Maven: The application runtime needs to be assembled manually providing great integration flexibility. The Core artifacts are mandatory runtime artifacts.

subsection.name: Container Adapters
subsection.p: The client container adapter provides the jDTAUS Container reference implementation and implements a runtime suitable for standalone, single-user client applications. The servlet container adapter extends that runtime for web applications.

jDTAUS RI Client Container site | JavaDoc.
jDTAUS RI Servlet Container site | JavaDoc.
Note: Web applications must be configured manually to work correctly with jDTAUS. See ServletFilter.

subsection.name: Logging Adapters
subsection.p: Three logging implementations to choose from. JDK 1.4, Log4J or Commons logging.

subsection.name: Task Monitoring Adapters
subsection.p: Two task monitoring implementations to choose from. The client monitor adapter implements a runtime suitable for client applications. The server monitor adapter implements a server runtime.
